alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 23 at 2:34AM MDT until October 24 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible Monday morning. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 10 AM this morning to 4 PM MDT this afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Blowing dust will reduce visibility to less than a quarter mile in places. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Avoid outdoor burning or any activity that may cause sparks. The strong winds could result in rapid fire growth. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
